verses.text: On that day they read in the book of Moses in the audience of the people ; and therein was found written , that the Ammonite and the Moabite should not come into the congregation of God for ever ;\f + \fr 13.1 \ft they…: Heb. there was read\f*\f + \fr 13.1 \ft audience: Heb. ears\f*
Because they met not the children of Israel with bread and with water , but hired Balaam against them, that he should curse them: howbeit our God turned the curse into a blessing.
Now it came to pass, when they had heard the law , that they separated from Israel all the mixed multitude. \p
¶ And before this, Eliashib the priest , having the oversight of the chamber of the house of our God , \add was\add* allied unto Tobiah :\f + \fr 13.4 \ft having…: Heb. being set over\f*

And he had prepared for him a great chamber , where aforetime they laid the meat offerings , the frankincense , and the vessels , and the tithes of the corn , the new wine , and the oil , which was commanded \add to be given\add* to the Levites , and the singers , and the porters ; and the offerings of the priests.\f + \fr 13.5 \ft which…: Heb. the commandment of the Levites\f*

But in all this \add time\add* was not I at Jerusalem : for in the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon came I unto the king , and after certain days obtained I leave of the king :\f + \fr 13.6 \ft after…: Heb. at the end of days\f*\f + \fr 13.6 \ft obtained…: or, I earnestly requested\f*
And I came to Jerusalem , and understood of the evil that Eliashib did for Tobiah , in preparing him a chamber in the courts of the house of God.
And it grieved me sore : therefore I cast forth all the household stuff of Tobiah out of the chamber.
Then I commanded , and they cleansed the chambers : and thither brought I again the vessels of the house of God , with the meat offering and the frankincense. \p
¶ And I perceived that the portions of the Levites had not been given \add them:\add* for the Levites and the singers , that did the work , were fled every one to his field.
Then contended I with the rulers , and said , Why is the house of God forsaken ? And I gathered them together , and set them in their place.\f + \fr 13.11 \ft place: Heb. standing\f*
Then brought all Judah the tithe of the corn and the new wine and the oil unto the treasuries.\f + \fr 13.12 \ft treasuries: or, storehouses\f*

And I made treasurers over the treasuries , Shelemiah the priest , and Zadok the scribe , and of the Levites , Pedaiah : and next to them \add was\add* Hanan the son of Zaccur , the son of Mattaniah : for they were counted faithful , and their office \add was\add* to distribute unto their brethren.\f + \fr 13.13 \ft treasuries: or, storehouses\f*\f + \fr 13.13 \ft next…: Heb. at their hand\f*\f + \fr 13.13 \ft their office…: Heb. it was upon them\f*

Remember me, O my God , concerning this, and wipe not out my good deeds that I have done for the house of my God , and for the offices thereof.\f + \fr 13.14 \ft good…: Heb. kindnesses\f*\f + \fr 13.14 \ft offices: or, observations\f* \p

¶ In those days saw I in Judah \add some\add* treading wine presses on the sabbath , and bringing in sheaves , and lading asses ; as also wine , grapes , and figs , and all \add manner of\add* burdens , which they brought into Jerusalem on the sabbath day : and I testified \add against them\add* in the day wherein they sold victuals.
There dwelt men of Tyre also therein, which brought fish , and all manner of ware , and sold on the sabbath unto the children of Judah , and in Jerusalem.
Then I contended with the nobles of Judah , and said unto them, What evil thing \add is\add* this that ye do , and profane the sabbath day ?
Did not your fathers thus, and did not our God bring all this evil upon us, and upon this city ? yet ye bring more wrath upon Israel by profaning the sabbath.

And it came to pass, that when the gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the sabbath , I commanded that the gates should be shut , and charged that they should not be opened till after the sabbath : and \add some\add* of my servants set I at the gates , \add that\add* there should no burden be brought in on the sabbath day.
So the merchants and sellers of all kind of ware lodged without Jerusalem once or twice.

Then I testified against them, and said unto them, Why lodge ye about the wall ? if ye do \add so\add* again , I will lay hands on you. From that time forth came they no \add more\add* on the sabbath.\f + \fr 13.21 \ft about: Heb. before\f*

And I commanded the Levites that they should cleanse themselves, and \add that\add* they should come \add and\add* keep the gates , to sanctify the sabbath day. Remember me, O my God , \add concerning\add* this also, and spare me according to the greatness of thy mercy.\f + \fr 13.22 \ft greatness: or, multitude\f* \p
¶ In those days also saw I Jews \add that\add* had married wives of Ashdod , of Ammon , \add and\add* of Moab :\f + \fr 13.23 \ft had…: Heb. had made to dwell with them\f*

And their children spake half in the speech of Ashdod , and could not speak in the Jews’ language , but according to the language of each people.\f + \fr 13.24 \ft could…: Heb. they discerned not to speak\f*\f + \fr 13.24 \ft of each…: Heb. of people and people\f*

And I contended with them, and cursed them, and smote certain of them, and plucked off their hair , and made them swear by God , \add saying\add*, Ye shall not give your daughters unto their sons , nor take their daughters unto your sons , or for yourselves.\f + \fr 13.25 \ft cursed: or, reviled\f*

Did not Solomon king of Israel sin by these things? yet among many nations was there no king like him, who was beloved of his God , and God made him king over all Israel : nevertheless even him did outlandish women cause to sin.
Shall we then hearken unto you to do all this great evil , to transgress against our God in marrying strange wives ?
And \add one\add* of the sons of Joiada , the son of Eliashib the high priest , \add was\add* son in law to Sanballat the Horonite : therefore I chased him from me.
Remember them, O my God , because they have defiled the priesthood , and the covenant of the priesthood , and of the Levites.\f + \fr 13.29 \ft because…: Heb. for the defilings\f*
Thus cleansed I them from all strangers , and appointed the wards of the priests and the Levites , every one in his business ;
And for the wood offering , at times appointed , and for the firstfruits. Remember me, O my God , for good.
